children.title: 2020 ‚û°Ô∏è Present: Fleetback
children.content:
# Summary
Digitalise the processes of car dealerships to facilitate the customer journey through a web application and a physical terminal that allows customers to drop off and pick up their keys without any contact with the dealership staff.

I led the refactoring of the application and enforced best practices to improve the processes in place. I also built the front-end stack for the terminal, using the latest technologies while relying on reliable libraries such as React or Webpack.
# Links
[Fleetback](https://fleetback.com)

children.title: 2018 ‚û°Ô∏è 2020: Carrefour
children.content:
# Summary
A web application based around a map showing the concurrency of Carrefour, aiming to gather multiple tools such as isochrones, filters or reverse-geocoding. I started this project from scratch using a full Javascript stack, based on NodeJS for the backend server and React/Redux for the frontend. I also set up a full CI/CD workflow for this project, using the Atlassian's tools Jira and BitBucket, Jenkins, Ansible and Docker.
# Links
[Carrefour](https://www.carrefour.com/)

children.title: 2017 ‚û°Ô∏è 2018: Partelya Consulting
children.content:
# Summary
I started as a front developer on an application similar to Meetup, named Caf√© to reinforce the team and speed up its development aiming banking institutions. Web and mobile application were based on AngularJS while the backend was made with NodeJS. Then I became the leader on this project to manage the full-stack of it.
# Links
[Partelya](https://partelya.com/)

children.title: 2018: ISPN
children.content:
# Summary
While working at Partelya Consulting, I taught JavaScript in this school to beginners and young students or older people who decided to change their career guidance.
# Links
[ISPN](https://www.ispn.fr/fr/poles/titres-professionnels/bac-3-designer-web-concepteur-designer-ui)

children.title: 2013 ‚û°Ô∏è 2017: SRCI
children.content:
# Summary
I took part of the conception and the development of a modular, on-premise, website. The backend was written in C# and the frontend ran with KnockoutJS. I also had to write a lot of scripts in various languages (Python, Batch or PowerShell) and I was involved on multiple projects such as an OCR, client-side websocket server, or an iOS application wrote with Objective-C.
# Links
[SRCI](https://solutions.srci.fr/)

children.title: 2013: TACT Factory
children.content:
# Summary
I worked as an intern on an Android application. I took part of the  the development of ePack Hygiene, an application for the catering sector which aims to digitalise health and safety management plans for food. I mainly worked on the initialization process, with the splashscreen and licensing information validation.
# Links
[TACT Factory](https://www.linkedin.com/company/tactfactory/about/)

[ePack Hygi√®ne](https://epack-hygiene.fr/)

children.content:

I graduated my Bachelor of Science degree (in French, licence profesionnelle) studying microcircuits, banking cards and applications (MCA) while working for [SRCI](#srci).
